title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: By 2025, the national social protection system has increased capacity to design, implement and monitor policies and programmes that better respond in an integrated and shock-responsive manner to the multidimensional vulnerabilities of children and families, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, vulnerable children and families benefit from improved child protection and social protection services

related-activity.ref: 4350/A0/06/883 IMPROVED CHILD PROTECTION AND SOCIAL PROTECTION SERVICES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, the national social protection system has increased capacity to design, implement and monitor policies and programmes thatbetter respond in an integrated and shock-responsive manner to the multidimensional vulnerabilities of children and families

description.narrative: The Conditional Cash Transfer for Education (CCTE) Programme for Refugees continued to support vulnerable refugee families by means of bi-monthly cash payments and child protection services. The programme surpassed its targets, benefiting 625,901 children in 2021, increasing the cumulative number to 760,858. ;In line with the new Country Programme, UNICEF partnership with the Ministry of Family and Social Services (MoFSS) expanded to include long-term system strengthening and integrated service delivery goals, particularly on increasing the shock-responsiveness and child-sensitivity of national social protection system and its linkages to child and family services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2022

title.narrative: Shock-responsive SP: Shock-responsive SP: Policy/strategy is adapted to support appropriate and timely vertical and/or horizontal expansion expansion of the existing social protection systems during crisis by government and/or humanitarian agencies (Link, Text

baseline.value: Level 1: SP policy or strategy in place, but no adaptation to make it shock responsive.

target.value: 2025: Level 3 – SP policy or strategy in place, and highly adapted to make it shock responsive.
